DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine effect obesity pharmacokinetics levonorgestrel ( LNG ) emergency contraceptive ( EC ) regimen marker ovulation Primary hypothesis : 1 ) Obese user LNG-EC pharmacokinetic profile consistent large volume distribution LNG . Secondary hypothesis : 1 . Alterations pharmacokinetic parameter LNG-EC regimen obese woman affect primary mechanism action , inhibition ovulation . 2 . Obesity may affect factor alter level LNG , sex-hormone binding globulin ( SHBG ) albumin , bind LNG potentially lower amount free LNG .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Obesity Pharmacokinetics Levonorgestrel Emergency Contraceptive Pill
DOC.criteria: Women age 1835 year Regular menstrual cycle ( 2435 day ) past 2 month Ovulatory define midluteal progesterone level > 3 ng/mL ( Day 1825 ) Belongs one follow category : normal weight ( BMI = 18.524.9 kg/m2 ) , obese ( BMI = 3039.9 kg/m2 ) extremely obese ( BMI ≥ 40 kg/m2 ) Participant intention desire conceive ( e.g. , active attempt become pregnant vitro fertilization ) duration study Participant agree consistently use effective method nonhormonal contraception throughout duration study , could include : condom ( male female ) without spermicidal agent , diaphragm cervical cap spermicide , nonhormonal intrauterine devise ( IUD ) , sterilization . Able give inform consent • Known renal liver disease Known pituitary disorder Known adrenal disorder Known thyroid disorder Use medication know alter cytochrome P450 system Use depotmedroxyprogesterone acetate previous 6 month hormonal contraceptive previous 3 month Currently breastfeed Pregnant Pregnancy prior month Known allergy medication Other specific contraindication LNG EC
